As a druid, you gain the follow class feature.
Hit Dice: 1d8 per druid level Hit Points at 1st Level: 8+ your Constitution modifier Hit Points at Higher Levels: 1d8( or 5)+ your Constitution modifier per druid level after 1st

Armor: Light armor, medium armor, shield( druid will not wear armor or use shield make of metal) Weapons: Clubs, dagger, dart, javelin, mace, quarterstaff, scimitar, sickle, sling, spear Tools: Herbalism kit Saving Throws: Intelligence, Wisdom Skills: Choose two from Arcana, Animal Handling, Insight, Medicine, Nature, Perception, Religion, and Survival

You start with the follow equipment, in addition to the equipment grant by your background: •( a) a wooden shield or( b) any simple weapon •( a) a scimitar or( b) any simple melee weapon • Leather armor, an explorer 's pack, and a druidic focus

You know Druidic, the secret language of druid. You can speak the language and use it to leave hidden message. You and others who know this language automatically spot such a message. Others spot the message 's presence with a successful DC 15 Wisdom( Perception) check but ca n't decipher it without magic.
Drawing on the divine essence of nature itself, you can cast spell to shape that essence to your will.
At 1st level, you know two cantrips of your choice from the druid spell list. You learn additional druid cantrips of your choice at high level, a show in the Cantrips Known column of the Druid table.

The Druid table show how many spell slot you have to cast your druid spell of 1st level and high. To cast one of these druid spell, you must expend a slot of the spell 's level or high. You regain all expend spell slot when you finish a long rest.

You prepare the list of druid spell that be available for you to cast, choose from the druid spell list. When you do so, choose a number of druid spell equal to your Wisdom modifier+ your Druid level( minimum of one spell). The spell must be of a level for which you have spell slot.

For example, if you be a 3rd-level druid, you have four 1st-level and two 2nd-level spell slot. With a Wisdom of 16, your list of prepared spell can include six spell of 1st or 2nd level, in any combination. If you prepare the 1st-level spell Cure Wounds, you can cast it use a 1st-level or 2nd-level slot. Casting the spell do n't remove it from your list of prepared spell. You can also change your list of prepared spell when you finish a long rest. Preparing a new list of druid spell require time spent in prayer and meditation: at least 1 minute per spell level for each spell on your list.

Wisdom be your spellcasting ability for your druid spell, since your magic draw upon your devotion and attunement to nature. You use your Wisdom whenever a spell refers to your spellcasting ability. In addition, you use your Wisdom modifier when set the save throw DC for a druid spell you cast and when make an attack roll with one.
Spell save DC= 8+ your proficiency bonus+ your Wisdom modifier
Spell attack modifier= your proficiency bonus+ your Wisdom modifier
You can cast a druid spell a a ritual if that spell have the ritual tag and you have the spell prepared.
You can use a druidic focus a a spellcasting focus for your druid spell.

Starting at 2nd level, you can use your action to magically assume the shape of a beast that you have see before. You can use this feature twice. You regain expend us when you finish a short or long rest.

Your druid level determines the beast you can transform into, a show in the Beast Shapes table. At 2nd level, for example, you can transform into any beast that have a challenge rating of 1/4 or low that do n't have a fly or swim speed.

You can stay in a beast shape for a number of hour equal to half your druid level( round down). You then revert to your normal form unless you expend another use of this feature. You can revert to your normal form earlier by use a bonus action on your turn. You automatically revert if you fall unconscious, drop to 0 hit point, or die.
While you be transform, the follow rule apply:

Your game statistic be replace by the statistic of the beast, but you retain your alignment, personality, and Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma score. You also retain all of your skill and save throw proficiency, in addition to gain those of the creature. If the creature have the same proficiency a you and the bonus in it stat block be high than yours, use the creature 's bonus instead of yours. If the creature have any legendary or lair action, you ca n't use them.

When you transform, you assume the beast 's hit point and Hit Dice. When you revert to your normal form, you return to the number of hit point you have before you transform. However, if you revert a a result of drop to 0 hit point, any excess damage carry over to your normal form, For example, if you take 10 damage in animal form and have only 1 hit point left, you revert and take 9 damage. As long a the excess damage do n't reduce your normal form to 0 hit point, you be n't knock unconscious.

You ca n't cast spell, and your ability to speak or take any action that require hand be limited to the capability of your beast form. Transforming do n't break your concentration on a spell you 've already cast, however, or prevent you from take action that be part of a spell, such a Call Lightning, that you 've already cast.

You retain the benefit of any feature from your class, race, or other source and can use them if the new form be physically capable of do so. However, you ca n't use any of your special sens, such a darkvision, unless your new form also have that sense.

You choose whether your equipment fall to the ground in your space, merges into your new form, or be worn by it. Worn equipment function a normal, but the DM decides whether it be practical for the new form to wear a piece of equipment, base on the creature 's shape and size. Your equipment do n't change size or shape to match the new form, and any equipment that the new form ca n't wear must either fall to the ground or merge with it. Equipment that merges with the form have no effect until you leave the form.

At 2nd level, you choose to identify with a circle of druid. Your choice grant you feature at 2nd level and again at 6th, 10th, and 14th level.

When you cast the spell in this way, the familiar be a fey instead of a beast, and the familiar disappears after a number of hour equal to half your druid level.

When you reach 4th level, and again at 8th, 12th, 16th, and 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability score of your choice by 1. As normal, you ca n't increase an ability score above 20 use this feature.

Whenever you reach a level in this class that grant the Ability Score Improvement feature, you can replace one cantrip you learn from this class 's Spellcasting feature with another cantrip from the druid spell list.
Starting at 18th level, the primal magic that you wield cause you to age more slowly. For every 10 year that pas, your body age only 1 year.
